20.text: You want to put what?! where?!

21S.text: Between elbow and... that's outrageous! I'm in!

22F.text: Inside the ear? At the same TIME?!

Meryl.3: That's a nice hat! You got style sis!
Meryl.20: Obviously I can, why do you ask?

30.text: Thanks, I appreciate those that can tell.

Armoise.1: I can't 'elp but wonder what your majestìque bodì is made of, mon chéri.
Armoise.2: I believe we should dàns together to thìs lounge musìque. Slowlì, charminglì, passionatelì...
Armoise.3: Your turquoise bodì is ...oh so very delicatlì shinì, marvellouslì sparklìng... Je suis captiveted.

10.text: And you'll keep being that way, 'mon chéri'. Wondering, that is.

Armoise.11: Sacré bleu, is something troublìng your days, darlìng? I can hear you out ma fille, you onlì need to ask.
Armoise.12: Oh, but I'm redì to do whatevèr you ask of me for that answer, you see.
Armoise.13: You're very mystèrious... Armoise, he likes mystèrious.

20.text: And I believe we should not. Here's a stalemate for you.

Armoise.21: Oh, why so? Are you perhaps insecure of your skìlls?
Armoise.22: Don't be shy chéri I'll guide you.
Armoise.30: Some people are lucky, I just so happen to be one of them.
Armoise.31: I can't help but wonder what your majestìque bodì is made of, mon chéri.
Armoise.32: I believe we should dàns together to thìs lounge musìque. Slowlì, charminglì, passionatelì...
Armoise.33: Some other people like confidence, as it happens I'm one of them.

11F.text: Well, if I pay close attention to it there is one small thing that's troubling me: it's you.

12S.text: I do. How about some floobing then? I can giggle and you'd dribble my bells, then we'd wobble and bobble and...

21F.text: Actually I simply find you repulsive.

31S.text: It's made of sugar, Armoise, do you want some?

Armoise.33S: That's nice of you to say.
